outputs.output_descr:
This is the second project funded by IBSA (India, Brazil and South-Africa), under the South-South Cooperation, in Guinea-Bissau.  It aims at increasing food-security, reducing poverty and augment economic-growth in IBSA´s intervention area  24 villages in the regions of Oio, Biombo and Bafata.  

It is comprised of two major components: Low Land Rehabilitation Support and Agricultural and Livestock Processing Support, and its expected outputs are: small plots of low-lying coastal lands rehabilitated for rice production; rice productivity increased; increased quantity and variety of agricultural and livestock products through transformation and preservation and local population able to commercialize agricultural and livestock products. The project is executed under UNDP´s DEX modality and it has MARD as implementing partner.

project_descr: Support for Low Land Rehabilitation and for Agricultural and Livestock Processing.
